DataElement.preferredName: Total Tumor Tissue Segment Weight Milligram Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity documenting the weight of all the malignant neoplasm tissue segments collected which are suitable for proteomic and genomic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 10/5/20 jk corrected property semantics.  10/1/20 jk created for Solid Tumor Procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
